comments: taosc flaw: memleakage
insert into ? values (?, ?)
different subtables using the different supertables, but the same structure
better not use this
implementation NOTE: once tblname is changed, set-tbname/get-tags-field/get-cols-field all have to be called again to refresh internal data structure
sqls: create table st1 (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))
create table st2 (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))

sqls.sql: insert into suzhou using st1 tags ('suzhou') values (1665226861289, 200)
insert into shanghai using st2 tags ('shanghai') values (1665226861299, 100)

comments: insert into ? values (?, ?)
different subtables using the different supertables, with different structures as well
better not use this
implementation NOTE: once tblname is changed, set-tbname/get-tags-field/get-cols-field all have to be called again to refresh internal data structure
sqls: create table st1 (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))
create table st2 (ts timestamp, name varchar(20)) tags (age int)

sqls.sql: insert into suzhou using st1 tags ('suzhou') values (1665226861289, 200)
insert into shanghai using st2 tags (123) values (1665226861299, 'v100')

comments: insert into ? values (?, ?)
different subtables using the same supertable
better not use this
implementation NOTE: once tblname is changed, set-tbname/get-tags-field/get-cols-field all have to be called again to refresh internal data structure
sqls: create table st (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))

sqls.sql: insert into suzhou using st tags ('suzhou') values (1665226861289, 200)
insert into shanghai using st tags ('shanghai') values (1665226861299, 100)

comments: insert into ? values (?, ?)
won't work if it's for normal table
and will result in memleakage
cooments: root cause: taosc: taos_stmt_set_tbname only works if the tablename is subtable
xsqls: create table shanghai (ts timestamp, age int)
create table suzhou (ts timestamp, age int)

comments: insert into ? using st tags (?) values (?, ?)
different subtables with using clause
better not use this
implementation NOTE: once tblname is changed, set-tbname/get-tags-field/get-cols-field all have to be called again to refresh internal data structure
sqls: create stable st (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))

sqls.sql: insert into suzhou using st tags ('suzhou') values (1665226861289, 200)
insert into shanghai using st tags ('shanghai') values (1665226861299, 100)
insert into ? using st tags (?) values (?, ?)

executes.comments: this is new tag, new subtable will be created with tag-values and col-values
cause `shanghai` subtable exists, tag value `foo` is left as it is in taosc-implementation
cause `suzhou` subtable exists, tag value `bar` is left as it is in taosc-implementation
this is new tag, although tag `foo` has already been used by subtbl `foo`, new subtable will be created with tag-values and col-values

sqls.sql: select count(*) from st where name = 'foo'

comments: insert into xsuzhou using st tags ('ysuzhou') values (1665226861289, 100)
there's no parameter placeholder marker, but prepare-bind-execute still works, except you only bind cols but not subtbl nor tags
better not use this
sqls: create stable st (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))

sqls.sql: insert into xsuzhou using st tags ('ysuzhou') values (1665226861289, 100)

comments: insert into ? using st tags (?) values (1665226861289, 100)
subtbl-tags as placeholder
very much weird, although rarely in practice, taosc API seemly exposes no clue to let application know which part the placeholder belongs to
sqls: create stable st (ts timestamp, age int) tags (name varchar(20))
insert into suzhou using st tags ('suzhou') values (1665226861288, 1)

sqls.sql: insert into ? using st tags (?) values (1665226861289, 100)
